description.narrative: GGF funds will support the David Suzuki Foundation's (DSF) Sustainable Seafood program, which push boundaries leading to on the water change. The program will engage directly with seafood businesses, seafood certification bodies, retailers, and consumers with the goal of establishing practices that provide food and employment while protecting species and ecosystems. Science assessments of fisheries and aquaculture operations have identified necessary changes to fishery and aquaculture management. DSF will work to build a constituency that supports sustainable seafood procurement, reduces consumption of non sustainable products and demands better management and more transparency in the marketplace. During the next year, DSF seeks to increase demand for sustainable seafood in Canadian markets and shift seafood marketing to promote sustainable options, build support for science based assessment sand certifications that will improve fishers and aquaculture, and reform at least two Canadian fisheries or aquaculture operations to reduce key environmental effects.
